caption:
This photograph depicts a devastated forest area, showing extensive damage likely due to logging or a storm. The foreground is filled with a chaotic jumble of fallen trees, broken branches, and scattered debris, covering the ground densely. The trees are stripped of their foliage with exposed, fractured trunks and limbs, suggesting a violent disruption of this wooded landscape.

In the background, the scene is similarly bleak. A rise in the terrain shows more standing trees, but these too appear damaged or dead, with sparse to no canopy remaining, standing stark against the sky. The color palette of the scene is muted, primarily consisting of dark browns and grays, which enhances the desolate feel of the landscape. The lighting appears to be dim, possibly due to an overcast sky or the time of day being either dawn or dusk, casting an overall gloomy atmosphere over the scene.
title: Logging debris left in a pothole. The land was clear-cut in 1972 by the Hama Company near Hood Canal, Washington. Washington near Olympic National Park.
